division.name: Back
division.group: Muscles of the back; Axioappendicular muscles, Posterior axioappendicular muscles, Extrinsic shoulder muscles, Superficial Posterior Axioappendicular muscles

element.name: Splenius capitis muscle
element.action: extend, rotate, and laterally flex the head

element.name: Splenius cervicis muscle
element.action: bilaterally: extend the head and neck, unilaterally: lateral flexion to the same side, rotation to the same side

element.name: Erector spinae muscles
element.nervelist: [CERVICAL NERVES - MOTOR ROOTS], [THORACIC NERVES - MOTOR ROOTS], [LUMBAR NERVES - ROOTS], [SACRAL AND COCCYGEAL NERVES - ROOTS]
element.action: extends the vertebral column

element.name: Interspinales muscles
element.nervelist: [CERVICAL NERVES - MOTOR ROOTS], [01, T1 nerve], [12, T12 nerve], [LUMBAR NERVES - ROOTS]
element.action: extension, flexion and rotation of vertebral column

element.name: Intertransversarii muscle
element.nervelist: [CERVICAL NERVES - MOTOR ROOTS], [01, T1 nerve], [12, T12 nerve], [LUMBAR NERVES - ROOTS]
element.action: lateral flexion of trunk

element.name: Multifidus muscle
element.nervelist: [CERVICAL NERVES - MOTOR ROOTS], [THORACIC NERVES - MOTOR ROOTS], [LUMBAR NERVES - ROOTS], [SACRAL AND COCCYGEAL NERVES - ROOTS]
element.action: stabilizes vertebrae in local movements of vertebral column

element.name: Rotatores muscles
element.action: facilitates the unilateral rotation and bilateral extension of the spine

element.name: Semispinalis capitis
element.action: extend the head

element.name: Semispinalis cervicis
element.action: extends and rotates the head to the contralateral side and also extends the ribs

element.name: Semispinalis dorsi (thoracis)
element.action: extends vertebral column

element.name: Obliquus capitis inferior muscle
element.action: rotation of head and neck

element.name: Obliquus capitis superior muscle
element.action: extends head and flex head to the ipsilateral side

element.name: Rectus capitis posterior major muscle
element.action: ipsilateral rotation of head and extension

element.name: Rectus capitis posterior minor muscle
element.action: extends the head at the neck, but is now considered to be more of a sensory organ than a muscle

element.name: External intercostal muscles
element.action: extends vertebral column

element.name: Internal intercostal muscles
element.action: extends vertebral column

element.name: Innermost intercostal muscle
element.action: extends vertebral column

element.name: Levatores costarum muscles
element.action: extends vertebral column

element.name: Serratus posterior inferior muscle
element.action: depress the lower ribs, aiding in expiration

element.name: Serratus posterior superior muscle
element.action: elevate the ribs which aids in inspiration

element.name: Subcostalis muscle
element.action: extends vertebral column

element.name: Transversus thoracis muscle
element.action: extends vertebral column

element.name: Thoracic diaphragm
element.action: increases thoracic cavity volume; inhalation

element.name: Abdominal external oblique muscle
element.action: rotates torso

element.name: Abdominal internal oblique muscle, roots
element.action: compresses abdomen and rotates vertebral column

element.name: Cremaster muscle
element.action: raise and lower the scrotum

element.name: Sebileau's muscle
element.action: corrugates the scrotum

element.name: Pyramidalis muscle
element.action: tensing the linea alba

element.name: Quadratus lumborum muscle
element.action: alone, lateral flexion of vertebral column; together, depression of thoracic rib cage

element.name: Rectus abdominis muscle
element.action: flexion of trunk/lumbar vertebrae

element.name: Transversus abdominis muscle, lower thoracic
element.action: compress the ribs and viscera, providing thoracic and pelvic stability

element.name: Transversus abdominis muscle, lumbosacral
element.action: compress the ribs and viscera, providing thoracic and pelvic stability

element.name: Ovary gland
element.action: secrete estrogen (maturation and maintenance of the reproductive organs), testosterone (prepares the uterus for pregnancy, and the mammary glands for lactation) and progesterone (promoting menstrual cycle changes in the endometrium)

element.name: Testicle gland
element.action: produce androgens, primarily testosterone (growth of muscle mass and strength, regulator of cognitive and physical energy, sperm development

element.name: Prostatic smooth muscles
element.action: emission (prior to ejaculation)

element.name: Iliococcygeus muscle
element.action: supports the viscera in pelvic cavity

element.name: Pubococcygeus muscle
element.action: controls urine flow and contracts during orgasm

element.name: Puborectalis muscle, roots
element.action: inhibit defecation

element.name: Puborectalis muscle, pudental
element.action: inhibit defecation

element.name: Coccygeus muscle
element.action: closing in the back part of the outlet of the pelvis

element.name: Bulbospongiosus muscle
element.action: in males, empties the urethra; in females, clenches the vagina

element.name: Ischiocavernosus muscle
element.action: stabilize the erect penis or (in females) tense the vagina during orgasm

element.name: Corpus cavernosum penis
element.action: penile erection; simultaneously the ischiocavernosus and bulbospongiosus muscles compress the veins of the corpora cavernosa restricting the egress and circulation of this blood

element.name: Corpus cavernosum clitoridis
element.action: clitoral erection; simultaneously the ischiocavernosus and bulbospongiosus muscles compress the veins of the corpora cavernosa restricting the egress and circulation of this blood

element.name: Deep transverse perineal muscle, clitoris
element.action: fixation of central tendon of perineum, support of pelvic floor, expulsion of semen in males and last drops of urine in both sexes

element.name: Deep transverse perineal muscle, penis
element.action: fixation of central tendon of perineum, support of pelvic floor, expulsion of semen in males and last drops of urine in both sexes

element.name: Sphincter ani externus muscle, motor
element.action: keep the anal canal and anus closed, aids in the expulsion of the feces

element.name: Sphincter ani externus muscle, pudental
element.action: keep the anal canal and anus closed, aids in the expulsion of the feces

element.name: Corrugator cutis ani muscle
element.action: raises the skin into ridges around the margin of the anus

element.name: Sphincter ani internus muscle, parasympathetic
element.action: keep the anal canal and anus closed, aids in the expulsion of the feces

element.name: Sphincter ani internus muscle, sympathetic
element.action: keep the anal canal and anus closed, aids in the expulsion of the feces

element.name: Superficial transverse perineal muscle
element.action: Fixation of central tendon of perineum, support of pelvic floor

element.name: Internal sphincter muscle of urethra, sympathetic
element.action: sympathetic contracts the muscle

element.name: Internal sphincter muscle of urethra, parasympathetic
element.action: parasympathetic relaxes the muscle

element.name: External sphincter muscle of male urethra
element.action: control urination, constricts urethra, maintain urinary continence

element.name: External sphincter muscle of female urethra
element.action: control urination, constricts urethra, maintain urinary continence

element.name: Detrusor urinae muscle, sympathetic
element.action: sympathetic relaxes, to store urine

element.name: Detrusor urinae muscle, parasympathetic
element.action: parasympathetic contracts, to urinate
